page.title: 06VILLAGE SHOP/POST OFFICE.
page.content: Once occupied by a garage (2_3pumps), a farmers' wholesale store selling grain, fertiliser, etc.,the site also held a wholesale local egg business. The deeds go back 150 years and the structure has 18" thick stone walls at rear and gable ends. Papers arrive at 4.00am from Rhyl,are prepared for delivery at 7.00am.The shop opens at 9.00am and closes at 5.30pm with 1hr lunchbreak. Half-day _ Thurs+Sat. Apart from the summer, the shop is closed on Sundays. A bread/greengrocery delivery service once operated (Tues+Thurs) until fuel costs rose. Now a small cafe occupies part of the shop area and a Bed and Breakfast facility is also offered. Supplies for the shop are obtained from cash/carry stores at Rhyl and Manchester. Frozen foodstuffs are bought from Denbigh.
